title: Eighties pop star Debbie Gibson shines in red-patterned mini dress at the Jojo Rabbit premiere in LA
text:
She became the youngest female artist -- at age 17 -- to write, produce and perform a Billboard Hot 100 number-one single with her hit song Foolish Beat in 1988.

Fast forward more than 30 years, and some 16 million album sales, and Debbie Gibson showed she can still command attention under the bright lights.

On Tuesday, the 49-year-old showed off her fit and youthful figure in a leggy red-patterned mini dress at the Los Angeles premiere of the black comedy film Jojo Rabbit.

Electric Youth: Debbie Gibson, 49, commended attention on the red carpet at the premiere of the dark comedy film Jojo Rabbit in Los Angeles on Tuesday

The Brooklyn, New York native used the eye-catching number to flaunt her tanned gams.

While falling to mid thigh, the piece also showed off her toned upper body with its form-fitting design and plunging neckline.

She rounded out her ensemble with black and metallic heels, and wore her blonde tresses long with some added waves and a part on the slight left.

Leggy: The Eighties pop star, 49, showed off her youthful figure in red-patterned mini dress

The Only In My Dreams singer wore her blonde tresses long with some added waves and a part on the slight left

Showstopper: The piece also showed off her toned upper body with its form-fitting design and plunging neckline

Jojo Rabbit follows the plight of a lonely 10-year-old German boy named Jojo 'Rabbit' Betzler (Roman Griffin Davis) during World War II.

His worldview gets turned upside down when he discovers his single mother (Scarlett Johansson) is hiding a young Jewish girl (Thomasin McKenzie) in their attic.

The only person he feels he can trust and count on is his imaginary friend, an idiotic version of Adolf Hitler (Taiki Waititi).

Jojo Rabbit hits theaters in the US October 18.

Pop stardom: Gibson had two hit albums under her belt by the time she was 19-years-old

Black comedy film: Jojo Rabbit hits theaters in the US October 18

Gibson knows a thing or two about what it's like under the media spotlight, with two hit albums under her belt by the time she was 19-years-old.

Her debut studio album in 1987 -- Out Of The Blue -- went on to spawn four international hits that included Foolish Beat, Shake Your Love, Only In My Dreams and Out Of The Blue.

Her 1989 follow-up -- Electric Youth -- also garnered a number of hits like Lost In Your Eyes and Electric Youth.

Although her chart-topping success slowly waned in the 1990s, Gibson continued to perform and write through to the 2000's.
description: Eighties pop star Debbie Gibson, 49, showed off her Electric Youth in red-patterned mini dress when she attended the Jojo Rabbit premiere in Los Angeles on Tuesday.
